conclusion: Identify the geometry of the headlight system with a paraboloid reflector and a hemispherical lens.
Light source is at the focal point F of the paraboloid.
Light-blocking plate is installed below the symmetry axis.
Light rays emitted from the focal point F travel parallel to the axis of the paraboloid after reflection.
Light enters the hemispherical lens where refraction occurs with refractive index n = 4/3.
Use Snell’s Law to relate angles of incidence and refraction.
Find the critical angle for total internal reflection using sin θc = 3/4.
Determine entry angle and calculate angle of refraction given the refractive index.
Calculate arc length on the lens spherical surface using radius R and angle θ.
Determine arc length using height 92.8 cm and lens geometry.
Critical angle for total internal reflection is approximately 48.6 degrees.
Light enters lens in a conical shape, transparent part is circumference of circle formed by light cone intersection with lens.
Final calculation of transparent arc length using R and angle θ.
